task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 12°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current view only shows the lower portion of the target building; looking up (increasing pitch to 30°) will allow me to see the full structure from ground to roof, which is necessary for estimating its height.
Moving to the front-left position (move 2) will bring me closer to the target building, allowing for a clearer view of its full structure and floor count to better estimate its total height.
Rotating right by 15 degrees will align my heading to 0° (due north), centering the target building in my view for a clearer, more complete look at its structure to estimate height.

The current view (pitch 0°) only shows the lower part of the target building; looking up with a pitch of 30° will allow me to see the upper structure, including the roof, which is essential for estimating its full height.
I can now see the full target building, which appears to have 8 floors; assuming a standard 3 meters per floor, the estimated total height is 24 meters.
